data.name: ErrorCannotLoadGlue
data.value: Could not load assemblies - you probably need to rebuild Glue.

data.name: ErrorLoadingSettings
data.value: Error loading your settings file which is located at

data.name: FilterResultsDescription
data.value: Begin a search with "f", "e", "s", "o", or "v" (letter then space) to filter results.

data.name: ErrorCannotOpenBrowser
EnterFileWithExtension
data.value: Enter the file name with extension, but no path (for example "myfile.png")

data.name: AttemptFindFileReferences
data.value: Trying to find file references, but could not find contained file {0}

data.name: NoLoadedGlueProject
data.value: There is no loaded Glue project

data.name: EnterCustomClassDeleteContents
data.value: Enter the custom class name. Delete the contents to not use a custom class.

data.name: GumPluginHandleNewFrbScreen
data.value: Gum Plugin - handle new FRB screen {0}

data.name: GumProjectFileCanOnlyAddedToGlobal
data.value: The Gum project file (.gumx) can only be added to global content.

data.name: GumErrorCreateFRBFirst
data.value: You must first create a FlatRedBall project before adding a Gum project

data.name: GumPluginGluxLoad
data.value: Gum plugin reacting to glux load

data.name: WarningLocalizationFileChange
data.value: This will also reload if localization CSV files change. If unchecked, the game will only respond to file changes (like TMX) in edit mode

data.name: ErrorGameThrewNullString
data.value: Null string returned back from the game

data.name: ErrorGameMustRunToGetStoredCommands
data.value: The game must be running to get its stored commands

data.name: EnableGameEmbedInSettings
data.value: Enable Game Embed and Edit in Settings

data.name: StartGameInEditMode
data.value: Starts the game in edit mode on the startup screen.

data.name: SelectStartupScreenInEdit
data.value: Selects the startup screen in edit.

data.name: MoveCameraToItemPlayAnimation
data.value: Moves the camera to the selected item and plays the selection animation.

data.name: CreateZipGameDistribution
data.value: Creates a .zip file for distributing your game.

data.name: ReduceGameSpeedSlowMotion
data.value: Reduce game speed (makes it run in slow-motion)

data.name: IncreaseGameSpeedFastForward
data.value: Increases game speed (makes it run in fast-forward)

data.name: GlueCannotCommunicateWithGame
data.value: Glue is unable to communicate with your game. To enable this communication, click the "Generate GlueControlManager in Game1" checkbox and restart the game

data.name: HintSetInputMovementType
data.value: Setting the input gesture type allows for standard keyboard, gamepad, or custom input gestures.

data.name: HintMovementNoneSelected
data.value: If None is checked, no movement code is generated.

data.name: HintTopdownMovementGeneration
data.value: If Top-Down is checked, standard top-down movement code is generated for moving in four directions.

data.name: HintPlatformerMovementGeneration
data.value: If Platformer is checked, standard platformer movement code is generated for moving horizontally and jumping.

data.name: HintGlueCanGenerateInput
data.value: Glue can generate standard input reading code. This can be overridden in code

data.name: HintGamepadCodeGeneration
data.value: Generates code to use a gamepad if plugged in, otherwise to use the Keyboard.

data.name: HintZeroInputGenerationCode
data.value: Generates code assigning a "zero" input device.

data.name: HintGenerateNoInputCode
data.value: Generates no input assignment code, which will cause exceptions if not assigned in code.

data.name: HintCreateDuplicateAnimationLayer
data.value: Create a duplicate of this animation layer.

data.name: HintPlatformerEntityInherit
data.value: This entity inherits from a Platformer Entity

data.name: HintEntityInheritsFromBase
data.value: If inherited, this entity will use this value as defined in the base entity.

data.name: HintOverwriteHidesBase
data.value: If overwriting, this entity's values for these movement values will be used instead of the base entity.

data.name: HintMaxSpeedPerPixel
data.value: The maximum speed in pixels per second that the entity can move due to input being applyed. This speed can be exceeded when on a moving platform.

data.name: HintSpeedToMaxStopsImmediate
data.value: Speeding up to maximum speed or down to stopping happens immediately.

data.name: HintSpeedToMaxStopsGradually
data.value: Speeding up to maximum speed or down happens gradually.

data.name: HintSecondsToAccelerate
data.value: The number of seconds to accelerate from a standstill to full speed.

data.name: HintSlowdownToStop
data.value: The number of seconds to decelerate from max speed to a standstill.

data.name: HintCustomDecelerationAboveMaxSpeed
data.value: Whether to use a custom deceleration value when moving above max speed. If false, then the Slow Down Time will be used to calculate a deceleration value. If true, a custom value will be used. This value shoudl be true for movement values with a Max Speed of 0.

data.name: HintDecelerationAboveMaxSpeed
data.value: The deceleration value to apply to the entity if it is moving above its max speed.

data.name: HintHorizontalMovementSlopesNotImpacted
data.value: Horizontal movement is not impacted by slopes.

data.name: HintHorizontalMovementSlopedImpacted
data.value: Horizontal movement is impacted by slopes.

data.name: SlopeMoveUphill
data.value: Character moves uphill at full speed on slope

data.name: CharacterStopMovingUphillSlope
data.value: Character stops moving uphill on slope

data.name: CharacterMovesFullSpeedOnSlope
data.value: Character moves downhill at full speed on slope

data.name: HintYVelocityForJumping
data.value: The Y velocity to assign when jumping. Setting a value of 0 means the entity cannot jump.

data.name: HintHoldToJumpHigher
data.value: If checked, the player can hold the jump button to jump higher. If unchecked, all jumps will be the same height, regardless of how long the jump button is held.

data.name: HintTimeAmountJumpHigher
data.value: The amount of time that the player can hold the jump button to jump higher. While the button is held, gravity is disabled.

data.name: HintPressDownThroughClouds
data.value: If checked, the player can press the down direction and jump to fall through clouds.

data.name: HintDistancePressCloudCollision
data.value: The amount of distance to fall when pressing down and jump on cloud before re-enabling cloud collision. This should be the height of one tile (typically 16).

data.name: HintGravityApply
data.value: The gravity (Y Acceleration) to apply to the entity. A positive value makes the entity fall downward.

data.name: HintIfValuesUsedForGroundMovement
data.value: If these values are used for ground movement with 0 or negative gravity, the entity may have its OnGround set to false every other frame.

data.name: HintValuesGroundMovementFallingSpeed
data.value: If these values are used for ground movement with 0 or negative Max Falling Speed, the entity may have its OnGround set to false every other frame.

data.name: HintClimbingPressingUp
data.value: Whether pressing up and down puts the player in a climbing state. When climbing, there is no gravity and up/down input directly sets the player's velocity.

data.name: HintVerticalSpeedForClimbing
data.value: The vertical movement speed when climbing.

data.name: HintDeletesMovementValues
data.value: Deletes this set of movement values.

data.name: HintDuplicateMovementValues
data.value: Create a duplicate of this set of movement values.

data.name: HintMovementTypeName
data.value: The name of the movement type. This name can be used in code to assign this movement type.

data.name: HintInheritedValueEntity
data.value: If inherited, this entity will use this value as defined in the base entity.

data.name: HintMaxSpeedPixelsSecond
data.value: The maximum speed in pixels per second that this entity can move through input. It is possible to move faster if another force (such as collision) acts on this entity.

data.name: HintImmediateMovementEntity
data.value: If using Immediate movement, this entity will immediately speed up when the input device is held down, and will immediately stop when the input device is released.

data.name: HintMaxSpeedUpDown
data.value: If using Speed Up/Down, this entity will gradually accelerate to max speed when the input device is held down, and will gradually slow down when the input device is released.

data.name: HintDirectionPropertyUpdateToVelocity
data.value: The Direction property should update according to the unit's velocity.

data.name: HintDirectionPropertyUpdateToInput
data.value: The Direction property should update according to the direction held on the input device, regardless of velocity.

data.name: HintDirectionUpdateInCustomCode
data.value: The Direction property should not update in generated code, but can be set in custom code.

data.name: HintEntityInheritsFromTopDown
data.value: This entity inherits from a Top-Down Entity

data.name: SetVariableByDerived
data.value: Set All Variables to SetByDerived = true

data.name: GameScreenOpposingTeamAdd
data.value: Add Opposing Team Index Collision Relationships to GameScreen

data.name: SelectFileOrClickBrowse
data.value: Select a file or click the Browse button

data.name: AskDownloadFileOverwrite
data.value: Do you want to download this file? It will overwrite:

data.name: StaticAllObjectsShareVariable
data.value: Static (all objects share one copy of the same variable)

data.name: ValidationTextForWrapping
data.value: This is validation text which is really long so that it line wraps okay? Yes, it should...

data.name: VariableTunnelIntoContainer
data.value: Tunnel a variable in a contained object

data.name: HintTopRowInformation
data.value: This is the top row with information. Below is the list box, custom control stack, then the button stack

data.name: DeleteAlsoFollowing
data.value: The following items will also be deleted:

data.name: DeleteQuestion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete?

data.name: SetAsStartupScreen
data.value: Set as StartUp Screen (first screen when running)

data.name: TmxNoFile
data.value: No TMX File (Can be added later)

data.name: HintGameZoomGlueCannotSet
data.value: The game's zoom cannot be set by Glue. The zoom will effectively be a result of the desired resolution and the resolution of the monitor.

data.name: HintSupportedOrientationsDocumentation
data.value: See the SupportedOrientations documentation for controlling mobile orientations.

data.name: EnterNameDisplaySetting
data.value: Enter a name for the display setting

data.name: ProjectSaveCameraChanges
data.value: Saving project due to camera changes

data.name: SkippingProjectNotFound
data.value: Skipping project {0} because a matching project was not found in {1}

data.name: PluginRestartToDelete
data.value: Success - Glue must be restarted to finish removing the plugin.

data.name: HintOrphanedFilesOfProject
data.value: Orphaned files are referenced by the current project but do not exist on disk. These files will cause compile errors in your project.

data.name: ErrorCannotOpenXamarin
data.value: Error opening Xamarin Studio - see error in output

data.name: GlueFileAssociation
data.value: Your machine has the file {0} associated with Glue. It should probably be associated with a programming IDE like Visual Studio

data.name: ErrorOpeningProjectVisualStudio
data.value: An error has occurred when trying to open the project. Please try again if Visual Studio has not opened.

data.name: ErrorCannotOpenProject
data.value: An error has occurred when trying to open the project file {0}.You can still open this project manually through Windows Explorer or Visual Studio. Additional info: {1}

data.name: ProjectIsAlreadySynced
data.value: The selected project is already a synced project.

data.name: EnterNewScreenName
data.value: Enter a name for the new Screen

data.name: ErrorNewProjectFirst
data.value: You need to create or load a project first.

data.name: TypeInfiniteRecursion
data.value: This type would result in infinite recursion

data.name: ExposedInDerivedCannotDelete
data.value: The following cannot be deleted because a base object has it marked as ExposedInDerived or SetByDerived:

data.name: FilesLeaveAsPartOfProject
data.value: Nothing - leave them as part of the game project

data.name: FilesRemoveFromProjectButKeep
data.value: Remove them from the project but keep the files

data.name: VariableMustSelect
data.value: You must select a variable on {0}

data.name: VariableInBaseAlreadyExists
data.value: There is already a variable named {0} in the base element, but it is not SetByDerived. Glue will not create a variable because it would result in a name conflict.

data.name: VariableAlreadyModifying
data.value: There is already a variable that is modifying {0} on {1}

data.name: VariableTypeMustBeSelectedForNew
data.value: A type must be selected for new variables

data.name: VariableIsExposableUseDifferentName
data.value: The variable {0} is an exposable variable. Please use a different variable name or select the variable through the Expose tab

data.name: VariableFrbReserved
data.value: The variable {0} is reserved by FlatRedBall.

data.name: CategoryEnterName
data.value: Enter a name for the new category

data.name: StateEnterName
data.value: Enter a name for the new state

data.name: ObjectCouldNotDefineFor
data.value: Could not find defining base object for {0}

data.name: GumAutoCreateForGlue
data.value: Automatically Create Gum Screens for Glue Screens

data.name: FilesIncludeNoneUseDllsOrSource
data.value: Include No Files (use linked .dlls or source)

data.name: FormClickAgainReAdd
data.value: (Clicking again will re-add all Forms content)

data.name: FormsIncludeComponents
data.value: Include Forms in Components With Behaviors

data.name: FormsAddDefaultToGum
data.value: Add Default Forms to Gum Component Associations

data.name: HintAutoPartitionDoesNotConsider
data.value: Automatic partitioning does not consider entity rotation, states, or custom code. Animations are considered if the Sprite is marked as setting collision.

data.name: HintPartitioningEnterWidthHeight
data.value: Enter the maximum of either width or height. This value is used for secondary partitioning, so enter the max of either dimension regardless of sort axis.

data.name: HintObjectAutoPartition
data.value: This object is automatically partitioned, or it does not need partitioning

data.name: HintObjectNotPartitioned
data.value: This object is not partitioned, so the collision relationship may run slowly

data.name: HintSubcollisionCannotDelegate
data.value: Subcollision cannot be set on Delegate Collision - the delegate can internally select which objects to collide.

data.name: HintCollisionsInactiveMayCalled
data.value: Inactive collisions will not automatically raise events and perform physics, but can be called manually in code

data.name: CollisionListVsList
data.value: List vs List Duplicate Collision Options

data.name: HintDoubleCollisionChecks
data.value: Double checks should be performed if doing self-collision on an entity list with each item using a different subcollision

data.name: MoveCollisionSoft
data.value: Move Soft Collision (separate overlapping objects over time)

data.name: ClearPointsAddRectangle
data.value: Would you like to clear the points and replace them with points for a rectangle shape?

data.name: HintEnterNumberOfPoints
data.value: Enter the number of points for the new polygon. At least 3 points are required. Note that the last point is automatically repeated, so only enter the number of visible points. For example, 3 for a triangle.

data.name: HintThisWillReplacePoints
data.value: This will completely replace the existing points on this polygon.

data.name: OnlyIntegerValuesAllowed
data.value: Only integer values are allowed. Invalid value: {0}

data.name: AtLeastThreePointsRequired
data.value: At least 3 points are required. Invalid value: {0}

data.name: ObjectAddDescription
data.value: Set the AddObject details here, depending on if it's a Screen or entity.

data.name: AddInstanceToSelectedList
data.value: Adds a new instance to the selected list

data.name: AddXXXInstanceToGameScreenDescription
data.value: Adds a single XXXX instance to the GameScreen

data.name: AddXXXFactoryDescription
data.value: Factories simplify the creation and addition of entities to screen lists. Factories are required to create entities through TMX files.

data.name: GlueWizardDescription
data.value: The New Project Wizard can help you get a fully functional game set up in seconds.

data.name: ProjectCreateNewDescription
data.value: Usually new projects target Desktop GL.

data.name: ProjectOpenDescription
data.value: Load an existing project from disk.

data.name: ProjectGumAddDescription
data.value: Gum is used to create UI and HUD.

data.name: AddScreenLevelDescription
data.value: Every game needs at least one screen. Usually the game logic is in a screen called GameScreen. Typically each level requires a new screen.

data.name: EntityAddDescription
data.value: Entities represent game objects like the player, enemies, bullets, and pick-ups.

data.name: SelectionStackNext
data.value: Selects the next item in the selection stack

data.name: CollapseFoldersExpandsTopLevel
data.value: Collapses all Screens and Entities, expands the top-level folders

data.name: SavingSettingsAfterDismissing
data.value: Saving settings after dismissing tree view

data.name: PlatformerStandardDescription
data.value: Creates a platformer project. Platformer games include a Player which can move horizontally and jump.

data.name: TopdownStandardDescription
data.value: Creates a top down game. Top down games include a Player which can move in all four directions.

data.name: UIFrbFormsDescription
data.value: Creates a game with a Main Menu and includes FlatRedBall.Forms.

data.name: CustomAdvancedDescription
data.value: Custom games can be created using a number of options controlling Player, Level, and UI setup.

data.name: WizardWelcomeLabel
data.value: This wizard will help you set up a Glue project quickly. Let's get started!

data.name: AutomaticallyCreateScreensTmx
data.value: Automatically Create Screens for TMX Files

data.name: TreeViewShowLevelScreens
data.value: Show Level Screens in Tree View

data.name: ContentFolderTmxAutoGlue
data.value: TMX files in the Content folder will automatically create Glue screens. These screens will show up in the tree view only if the check box above is checked.These screens can be accessed in code.

data.name: HintTileShapeCollection
data.value: This TileShapeCollection is defined in a base Screen. Changes must be made in the base screen.

data.name: FromTmxCollision
data.value: From TMX Collision - requires shapes defined in the tileset (TSX)

data.name: HintChangingTileTsx
data.value: Changing the tile may also modify the underlying TSX

data.name: HintRunGameLiveFRB
data.value: *Running your game with edit mode enabled requires a live connection to the FlatRedBall Editor. Click Allow Access to enable the connection.

data.name: ShowScreenBoundsWhenViewingEntities
data.value: Show screen bounds when viewing entities

data.name: RestartScreenOnLevelContentChange
data.value: Restart screen on level content change

data.name: HintMostGamesMultipleScreens
data.value: Most games have multiple screens. Examples include title screens, level selection screens, and settings screens.

data.name: HintNeedAtLeastOneScreen
data.value: Every game needs at least one screen. Usually the game logic is in a screen called GameScreen.

data.name: HintCommonEntityTypes
data.value: Common entity object types include sprites and shapes for collision.

data.name: HintCommonEntityTypesRelationships
data.value: Common screen object types include entity lists, layers, and collision relationships.

data.name: HintListMultipleCopiesOfEntity
data.value: Lists enable multiple copies of this entity to exist in the game screen.

data.name: HintGameScreenAddInstance
data.value: Adds a single instance to the GameScreen. This is usually done if there will only ever be one of these in the game screen at any time.

data.name: NameCannotStartWithNumber
data.value: Names can't start with a number.

data.name: NameCannotHaveSpaces
data.value: The name can't have any spaces.

data.name: NameEngineReserved
data.value: The word '{0}' is a reserved word used by the engine. This can't be used as a name

data.name: NameXIsCSharpKeyword
data.value: The word '{0}' is a C# keyword. This can't be used as a name

data.name: NameInvalidAmbiguity
data.value: The word '{0}' is an invalid name because it can cause ambiguity

data.name: VariableYAlreadyInX
data.value: This {0} already has a variable named {1}

data.name: NameXHasObjectYInvalid
data.value: This {0} has an object named {1} so you must choose a different variable name

data.name: NameXCannotBeSameAsY
data.value: The variable name {0} cannot be the same as its {1}

data.name: VariableXReservedByFrb
data.value: The variable {0} is reserved by FlatRedBall.

data.name: NameXReservedByWindows
data.value: The name {0} is a reserved file name in Windows

data.name: ProjectContainsEntityWithFileName
data.value: Your project contains an entity named {0} which is the same name as your file. Glue does not allow files with the same names as Entities to be added as this can result in code ambiguity.

data.name: ScreenNamedXExists
data.value: There is already an Screen named {0}

data.name: FileNamedXExists
data.value: There is already a file named {0}

data.name: ScreenNameReservedForClass
data.value: The name {0} is a reserved class name, so it can't be used for a Screen

data.name: EntityXAlreadyExists
data.value: There is already an Entity named {0}. Glue recommends naming the Class something different than existing Entities.

data.name: HintClassCannotBeNamedRootNamespace
data.value: The class cannot be named the same as the root namespace (which is usually the same name as the project)

data.name: NameCannotBeReservedClassName
data.value: The name {0} is a reserved class name, so it can't be used for a State Category

data.name: NameAlreadyUsedInCategory
data.value: The name {0} is already being used in the category {1}

data.name: NameStateAlreadyUsedInBase
data.value: This state name '{0}' is already used in a base {1}

data.name: ObjectNotSetInDerived
data.value: There is an object named {0} in the base Element but it is not Set By Derived.

data.name: NameAlreadyUsed
data.value: The name {0} is already being used

data.name: ObjectCannotUseNameOfContainer
data.value: You can't name your Object the same name as the {0} it is contained in.

data.name: ObjectNameCannotStartWithNumber
data.value: Object names can't start with numbers

data.name: NameIsExistingOrExposed
data.value: The name {0} is an existing or exposable variable name in {1} so it is not a valid object name

data.name: NameNotAllowedForObjects
data.value: The name '{0}' is not an allowed name for objects.

data.name: NameIsReservedByPositionedObject
data.value: The name '{0}' is a reserved name by the PositionedObject Type.

data.value: Critical Error: Dotnet has not been found on your device. Please install it - and if done so already, please check your environment variables

data.name: ErrorCouldNotFindNetSix
data.value: Could not find any versions of .NET 6.XX SDKs installed. Glue may not be able to load projects. We recommend installing .NET 6 SDK. dotnet --list-sdks output: {0}

data.name: ErrorDotnetMultipleIssue
data.value: You may have multiple installations of .NET on your machine. More info here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65692530/why-dotnet-list-sdks-does-not-show-installed-sdks-on-windows-10. Press CTRL+C on this popup to copy the text so you can paste it in an external editor and open that URL.
